definition: lit. a tall tree attracts the wind (idiom)/fig. a famous or rich person attracts criticism
tree/CL:棵[ke1]/to cultivate/to set up
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]

sentences.english: Simply because you wind big tree?
sentences.chinese: 仅仅是因为树大招风吗？

definition: lit. people fear getting famous like pigs fear fattening up (for the slaughter)/fig. fame has its price
pinyin: ren2 pa4 chu1 ming2 zhu1 pa4 zhuang4

definition: the shot hits the bird that pokes its head out (idiom)/nonconformity gets punished
lit. easy to dodge the spear in the open, hard to avoid a stab in the dark (idiom); it is hard to guard against secret conspiracies
pinyin: ming2 qiang1 yi4 duo3 , an4 jian4 nan2 fang2

definition: lit. under a big tree the shade is plentiful (idiom)/fig. to benefit by proximity to an influential person
pinyin: da4 shu4 di3 xia4 hao3 cheng2 liang2

definition: lit. strong dragon cannot repress a snake (idiom); fig. a local gangster who is above the law
pinyin: qiang2 long2 bu4 ya1 di4 tou2 she2

definition: to antagonize people/to make an enemy of sb
lit. to invite the wind/fig. conspicuous and inviting criticism
to amass wealth while keeping a low profile (idiom)
lit. treasuring a jade ring becomes a crime (idiom); to get into trouble on account of a cherished item/fig. A person's talent will arouse the envy of others.
wind direction/the way the wind blows/fig. trend/direction of events/how things develop (esp. how they affect oneself)/public opinion (concerning one's actions)/publicity (usually derog.)/limelight
lit. public opinion is powerful enough to melt metal (idiom)/fig. public clamor can obscure the actual truth/mass spreading of rumors can confuse right and wrong
two tigers fighting (idiom); fierce contest between evenly matched adversaries
lit. target of a multitude of arrows (idiom); the butt of public criticism/attacked on all sides
gossip is a fearful thing (idiom)
to conceal one's strengths and bide one's time (idiom)/to hide one's light under a bushel
however strong you are, there is always someone stronger (idiom)/there is always sth more to learn/never be satisfied to rest on your laurels/there is no room for complacency
pinyin: qiang2 zhong1 zi4 you3 qiang2 zhong1 shou3
